New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 5 月 1 日，星期三 18:01:31 +0000 zh 1每小时1
New Zealand Rugby governance battle: East Coast boss urges rival sides to settle differences https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/02/new-zealand-rugby-governance-battle-east-coast-boss-urges-rival-sides-to-settle-differences/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/02/new-zealand-rugby-governance-battle-east-coast-boss-urges-rival-sides-to-settle-differences/ Neil ReidThere is a push for any new national board to look after the game at a grassroots level. Wed, 01 May 2024 17:30:00 +0000 The boss of the Ngāti Porou East Coast Rugby Union says grassroots rugby is vital and has called for rival sides in the ongoing New Zealand Rugby governance battle to settle their differences. Photo / Neil Reid
Rotorua homeless motels: When will emergency housing end? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-homeless-motels-when-will-emergency-housing-end/XT5AMQ366ZBSTEX5OVWSC7J42M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-homeless-motels-when-will-emergency-housing-end/XT5AMQ366ZBSTEX5OVWSC7J42M/ Kelly MakihaMeetings have been held on the future of emergency housing in the city. Wed, 01 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Extending Government-run emergency housing motels in Rotorua is a hot topic for (from left) Associate Housing Minister Tama Potaka, resident spokeswoman Carolyne Hall, Rotorua MP Todd McClay and Rotorua Mayor Tania Tapsell. Photos / NZME
Teenage girl terrified after attack by 20 kids at New Lynn bus station https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/teenage-girl-terrified-after-attack-by-20-kids-at-new-lynn-bus-station/J3OC6AMJT5DLHNEV27I3PD2IEI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/teenage-girl-terrified-after-attack-by-20-kids-at-new-lynn-bus-station/J3OC6AMJT5DLHNEV27I3PD2IEI/ Raphael FranksIt is another in a series of incidents against teenagers at Auckland bus stations. Wed, 01 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 A 13-year-old girl was attacked by a group of 20 children at New Lynn bus station in West Auckland and, according to her mother, is now too traumatised to take the bus.
Government tax increase kicking commercial property when it’s down https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/government-tax-increase-kicking-commercial-property-when-its-down/DTCWSVBRPBB6VOJ7OV43QQGI5A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/government-tax-increase-kicking-commercial-property-when-its-down/DTCWSVBRPBB6VOJ7OV43QQGI5A/ Jenée TibshraenyVacancies in office and retail spaces are on the rise, as property owners face a tax hike. Wed, 01 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Vacant office and retail spaces rise, as 1.1 per cent of bank loans secured against commercial property are deemed non-performing. Photo / Alex Cairns
Breaking ‘Bad’: Youth crime at ‘crisis point’ - is there a silver bullet? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/writing-bad-youth-crime-at-crisis-point-is-there-a-silver-bullet/IC4BR3GPE5C33O3R5F44NADWOM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/writing-bad-youth-crime-at-crisis-point-is-there-a-silver-bullet/IC4BR3GPE5C33O3R5F44NADWOM/ Anna LeaskJournalist Anna Leask looks into how Australian communities are tackling youth crime. Wed, 01 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Breaking 'Bad' is a two-day series looking at youth offending and whether there is anything that will 'fix' the problem.
Tasman council fighting couple over Wakefield swimming pool claws back damages https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tasman-council-fighting- Couple-over-swimming-pool-claws-back-more-than-270k-in-damages/GMDZRUVACRFA3BPL3A5Y52TZRY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tasman-council-fighting- Couple-over-swimming-pool-claws-back-more-than-270k-in-damages/GMDZRUVACRFA3BPL3A5Y52TZRY/ Tracy NealHe was told feature complied with rules around the fencing of pools. Then it didn't. Wed, 01 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 The swimming pool at the centre of the couple’s award-winning home in Wakefield, near Nelson, before it was found it didn't comply and had to be fenced.
Budget 2024: The Government needs a good Budget; why it might not deliver one https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/budget-2024-the-government-needs-a-good-budget-why-it-might-not-deliver-one/GN5RDNEU3ZEDJC26KHP45AXQRU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/budget-2024-the-government-needs-a-good-budget-why-it-might-not-deliver-one/GN5RDNEU3ZEDJC26KHP45AXQRU/ Thomas CoughlanAfter a bad poll, the Government needs to find a way to make voters feel happier. Letters: MPs deserve fair pay - so do nurses, teachers and cops; school can’t always be entertaining; dog’s death completely avoidable https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/letters-mps-deserve-fair-pay-so-do-nurses-teachers-and-cops-school-cant-always-be-entertaining-dogs-death-完全可避免/3WVE6DOF55BQDLOIKKGYWSJW4U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/letters-mps-deserve-fair-pay-so-do-nurses-teachers-and-cops-school-cant-always-be-entertaining-dogs-death-完全可避免/3WVE6DOF55BQDLOIKKGYWSJW4U/ OPINION: 'These groups should be placed under the Remuneration Authority’s control too.' Photo / Martin Sykes

Wed, 01 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 The $11.5 million Te Hiku Sports Hub in Kaitāia is about a month away from opening.
Rocket Lab’s PREFIRE mission to track polar heat for climate study https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/01/rocket-labs-prefire-mission-to-track-polar-heat-for-climate-study/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/01/rocket-labs-prefire-mission-to-track-polar-heat-for-climate-study/ Rocket Lab's next mission, 'Ready, Aim, PREFIRE', is set for launch on or after May 22 Wed, 01 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Rocket Lab is preparing for a PREFIRE mission, a climate change-focused mission to measure the heat lost from the Arctic and Antarctica. Photo / Rocket Lab
